Posted By: HairlessThoctar (1/27/2011 4:54:00 PM)

posts.post_content:
Well, Goatllama, if we're going for massive typeline, why don't we keep going?   
  
Use [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) and his own -1 ability to turn him into an Artifact Creature Planeswalker, alright, cool.  
  
*Now* play [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening) and turn him into an Artifact Creature Enchantment Planeswalker. Not enough? Alright, equip Tezzeret with [Runed Stalactite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runed Stalactite) and then play [Life and Limb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life and Limb). Hell, let's go even more out there!  
  
Play [Rimefeather Owl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rimefeather Owl) and then use its ability to put an ice counter on it, giving it the snow subtype!  
  
Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas  
  
Snow Artifact Creature Enchantment Land Planeswalker - Forest Tezzeret  
  
(( In addition to being all creature types. ))  
  
You, proud sir, are now in ownership of the greatest card known to Magicdom. Even Storm Crow weeps at it's awesome typeline.
posts.html:

Play Rimefeather Owl and then use its ability to put an ice counter on it, giving it the snow subtype!

Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas

Snow Artifact Creature Enchantment Land Planeswalker - Forest Tezzeret

(( In addition to being all creature types. ))

You, proud sir, are now in ownership of the greatest card known to Magicdom. Even Storm Crow weeps at it's awesome typeline.

Posted By: marwinshieldscale (6/24/2011 11:38:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
First Ruling under the MBS FAQ states as followed:
  
\* The artifact targeted by the second ability will retain any types, subtypes, or supertypes it has. Notably, if an Equipment becomes an artifact creature, it can't be attached to another creature. If it was attached to a creature, it becomes unattached.
  
So there for Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas would become an Artifact Creature Planeswalker if you use Liquimetal Coating on him and his second ability on him self.
posts.html:
First Ruling under the MBS FAQ states as followed:
* The artifact targeted by the second ability will retain any types, subtypes, or supertypes it has. Notably, if an Equipment becomes an artifact creature, it can't be attached to another creature. If it was attached to a creature, it becomes unattached.
So there for Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas would become an Artifact Creature Planeswalker if you use Liquimetal Coating on him and his second ability on him self.
